SENT.plain: The authors describe the essential neurological complications observed during the follow-up of glioblastomas treated by sequential chemotherapy
They were studied on the basis of clinical, isotopical, CT scanner and or anatomical data
The most frequent complications are: epilepsy, acute neurological deficiency and intracranial hypertension
The diagnostic significance of the complications are discussed
Usually, they expresse a tumour extension
However, the recurrence presents varied aspects
It can be infiltrating and extensed, multifocal, focal, cystic ou pseudocystic
In the majority of cases the morphological, topographical and evolutional characters can determine the therapeutical attitude
